In 1943 a farmer here in the small town
of San Juan was tending to his crop like

normal farmers do, and then in between
his corn, a 2 meter crack opened up when

he was working.
Shortly after... plumes of sulfur smelling

smoke started erupting out of this crack.
He ran to town and told everybody what

happened. Later that night, that crack
opened and started spewing tons and tons
of sulfurous ash, and buried the town.

Fast
forward 60 years and the town looks like this.

Completely covered in volcanic rock.
All that's left, is the Church of San Juan...
just the tower, and  everything else it's buried

under meters and meters of jagged black
stone. This is the story of Volcan Paricutin
